job_title: Administrative in Larkspur, CA
pros: This organization is true to its mission to provide care to people from all walks of life and circumstances. I have worked here for many years and stay because of the people, the richness of the work and the organization culture. People care about each other and are passionate about the work being done.
cons: Healthcare is challenging these days, but this organization cares about its staff and mission. Managers and leadership have an open-door policy and new ideas and feedback are always welcomed.

job_title: Physical Therapist Assistant in Sonoma, CA
pros: The clinicians are respected and patients benefit tremendously from the best care in home health!
cons: No complaints about this gem of a workplace!

job_title: Sr. Administrative Assistant in San Francisco, CA
pros: Meaningful on a daily basis.
cons: Pay is low, i.e., doesn't meet standard of living.

review_title: Best job in my 20 year nursing career!
job_title: After Hours Manager in Sonoma, CA
pros: I have worked at By the Bay Health since 2012 in the After-Hours department in the field. I love working here for so many reasons! The flexibility and ability to start work from home, the intimacy of working with patients and families in their homes, the ability to make such a huge impact on patient's quality of live, the always available team of hospice doctors, the charge nurses that are always there to support you, plus the teamwork and management support is better than any other place I have experienced. Not to mention my stress level is down and my work life balance is finally balanced!
cons: No downsides to working here!

review_title: Very demanding patients and families  for the little  pay
job_title: HHA/CNA in San Rafael, CA
pros: You can get a lot of experience and then get a better pay job
cons: Drive long distances, with not enough driving time, trying to make it on time to the next appointment. Beside your full schedule you need to do another assignments, chart, enter your time shift, order your supplies, order/pick up your ppe in the office, do corvid test .

job_title: Admission Nurse in San Francisco, CA
pros: flexible schedule, work from home options
cons:
for the work we do we are not
paid enough compared to other hospice agencies in the area

review_title: love the work not the job
job_title: Licensed Vocational Nurse (LVN) in Sonoma, CA
pros:
pays well when you're getting differential
okay benefits
cons:
management expects work to be your entire life
hours
poor staffing
constant changes in company

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Larkspur, CA
pros: the staff seeing patients are hardworking compassionate people.
cons: Leadership is horrible and incompetent. A chaotic and degrading atmosphere that starts at the top with the CEO. Senior leadership awards themselves enormous raises, 40-75% while everyone else gets 1%. they can't retain staff and when you bring concerns up to HR or directors, you become the problem. Google toxic work environment and you will get an accurate overview.

review_title: Good organization but not enough pay
job_title: Hospice RN Case Manager in San Francisco, CA
pros: Great coworkers and manager, good morale, supportive environment.
cons: Salary not competitive in the industry. No hazard pay for Covid patients. Less raise each year you work.

job_title: Physical Therapist in Santa Rosa, CA
pros: flexible schedule, very nice clinical team members
cons: poor benefits, low pay, large geographic spread

job_title: Assistant Volunteer Coordinator in Larkspur, CA
pros: Good mission and some nice co-workers. Nice location and care for clients
cons: Micro management not much room for growth low pay look down on certain positions

review_title: Great People Committed To A Great Cause
job_title: Client Services Representative in Larkspur, CA
pros: Great people and rewarding position.
cons: Challenging office politics and turnover rate.

review_title: Fast paced, respectful culture, meaningful work, low pay
job_title: Bereavement in Larkspur, CA
pros: Well-trained staff. who are supportive of each other. Effective and visionary Senior Leadership.
cons: Low pay, Caseloads too high. Certain managers are perfectionistic. Staff are not given meaningful opportunities to evaluate their Manager's performance. The annual Performance Evaluation process is outdated and does not serve to inspire professional development.

review_title: Used to be a great company, not any more
job_title: Home Health Aide in Larkspur, CA
pros: Dedicated, compassionated , supportive coworkers
cons: It used to be a great company until they change the name, now they are greedy and don’t care about their employees, they lie to you to make you do things you are not under your scope of practice. Everything they care is about money for themselves not for the employees. High demanding family/ patients with highly expectations

job_title: Admissions Clinical Support in Larkspur, CA
pros: Truly wonderful people united in making clients and families experience as good as possible at the end of life.
cons: Don't get to see everyone in the organization.

job_title: Admi in San Francisco, CA
pros: Culture, diversity, working environment, respect
cons: Compensation, management support, career advancement

job_title: Registered Nurse in San Francisco, CA
pros: Great people to work with
cons: pay, pay, pay, pay, pay

review_title: Collaborative teams, rewarding work, and good people
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Larkspur, CA
pros: The clinical team I was on was top notch in regards to communication with each other, and their desire to do their best work possible from each profession's scope of practice. Ninety-eight percent of other staff interactions were  very positive. High values and expectations from the top down.  Approachable management. Free food offered frequently. Diverse group of employees.
cons: Being a non profit, they have to re-invest any extra income. It appears they do re-models of the building, while many employees wish they would bump up salaries instead, although they pay a fair wage.

review_title: Great people to work "with", but TERRIBLE company to work "for".
job_title: Systems Administrative in Larkspur, CA
pros:
The doctors, nurses, bereavement, and home health aides are some of the most fantastic and wonderful people I've ever had the pleasure to meet and work with. They all deserve raises.
Hospice is an underrated and much needed service.
cons:
Upper level management could seemingly care less about the well being of its employees. Routinely lets go dedicated and hard working people, then forces the job responsibilities of those let go on the employees that remain - no raises, no title changes.
Was told specifically "You are an expense, no more no less" when let go 2 months into FMLA (illegal btw).
No room for advancement

job_title: Registred Nurse in San Francisco, CA
pros: A lot of autonomy and creativity in patient care. Nurses can really make a difference for the patients. Great collaboration among disciplines.
cons: Money is always an issue that can influence the decisions made and there are a lack of boundaries. Nurses are always over their agreed caseload amount and end up having to work overtime to keep up.

job_title: RN Case Manager in San Francisco, CA
pros: Healthy place to work, lots of support, knowledgeable Doctors and Supportive managers. Great place to learn  -flexible hours to accommodate family needs.
cons: Commute/parking can be challenge in home care -- but you get used to it and discover NPR like I did.

job_title: Intake Coordinator in Larkspur, CA
pros: I really enjoyed working at HBTB was close relationships I formed with my coworkers.
cons: Working for a nonprofit your compensation can always be improved.

job_title: Patient Care Coordinator in San Francisco, CA
pros: Great employees, good benefits, rewarding work
cons: low salary - poor management

job_title: Admssions RN in Larkspur, CA
pros: Meaningful work, independence,  supportive coworkers
cons: Stress/overtime, driving long distances in heavy traffic

job_title: Home Health Aide in Larkspur, CA
pros: Great work environment with professional, impressive, heart-centered personnel.
cons: There is nothing I would change about this company.

job_title: Hospice Chaplain in Larkspur, CA
pros: Shared vision by clinical staff, meaningful work
cons: many changes, too many computer forms

job_title: Registered Nurse in Larkspur, CA
pros: The patients and families in need of end if life care.
cons: Non-nurse clinical managers -- inept and unappreciative of the job of and challenges of the Hospice Nurse.
